reviewText: Easy to follow.  Not a lot of chatter.  It really works you out. Intermediate level. Great workout. WOW!
summary: Not too easy, not too hard
Title: N/A

reviewText: Kathy Smith's Great Buns and Thighs will make you sore the next day and will tone your legs. However, if you are looking for cardio, this is not it. There are 3 segments to "step" to:Segment 1: 16 minutes long with lots of squats and leg lifts while stepping.Segment 2: 10 minutes long with squats, squats, squats and some minor stepping.Segment 3: 10 minutes long with all floor work to tone the legs. You work 1 side then the other then both sides while on your back.My problem with this video is that it is not a STEP workout really. It just pretends to be one. Overall you get MAYBE 20 minutes of cardio out of it. Your heart rate will not really increase during this video. If you are looking for that, Kathy's other step tapes (see my other reviews) are good for cardio.
summary: Not much of a STEP workout
Title: N/A

reviewText: I agree with what some others have said about this not truly being a step workout. I still really like it though. There is a 9 minute warm-up (even though on the back of the DVD, it says 6 minutes) in addition to the 3 main segments (Segment 1 is 16 mins, Segment 2 and 3 are 10 mins each) and a 5 minute cool down. So it is a nice long workout. The first segment is the one that is a true step workout. The second is mostly squats. The third is on the floor. So what I often do to make it a full step workout is to do the warm-up, do the first segment twice, then do the second segment, and either stop there or go on to segment 3.The music is pretty yucky in spots; but you can get used to it and not really notice how icky it is. And if your opinion of Kathy Smith is similar to mine then you will find her a little annoying in this DVD like in others. But she's less goofy-cheerleader in this DVD than in some others. So she's a bit more tolerable. (I realize I'm hard on her. I prefer Karen Voight's demeanor to Kathy Smith's. Voight is more down-to-business.)Overall, I think it is a great lower body workout; and if you repeat the first segment, you can make it very cardio-intensive. I've definitely noticed my legs getting stronger as a result.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I generally like Kathy Smith workouts, but this is my least favorite because of the lack of variety in step routine.  It truly feels like I'm doing boring, repetitious moves, and I constantly feel the urge to stop. It does work out the lower body well, but it doesn't motivate me much, seeming like more of a chore than a fun routine compared to her other videos.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really like this workout with its focus on the legs and buns.  This one provides noticeable results!
summary: Challenging Workout For The Lower Body
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video has been a staple of my home exercise library for years and it's the one I keep going back to.  I used to do it with wrist and ankle weights, and jumping (Kathy calls it "propulsion") at every opportunity - let me tell you, that was an intense cardio workout!  It kept me in great shape and I loved the results.Now that I am 17 weeks pregnant with my first baby, this is still my favorite fitness video, except I do the low-impact beginner variations of every routine.  Hands down, it beats every other pregnancy fitness video I've tried.  (Note:  I do not do the floor exercises on this DVD now that I am pregnant.)I recommend for anyone of any fitness level in order to feel great and get results.  Exercise sessions are broken out well so you can cut out a segment if you don't have time.  Kathy has great cueing and it's easy to follow: not as choreography-intensive as some other step videos.  Enjoy!
summary: Best lower body workout for anyone
Title: N/A
